intro: Gynandropsis heterotricha, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its unique, spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense heads, typical of the daisy family. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots and reduced leaf surfaces to minimize water loss. Gynandropsis heterotricha is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some African cultures for various health purposes.
